文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_041_chunk1
证据片段: After two cycles of irradiation to an assembly burnup of 37.8 GWD/MTU, the average axial peak corrosion of ZIRLO was $32 \%$ that of conventional Zircaloy-4.

证据片段: Correlation of the in-reactor data with the autoclave data indicates that the $\pmb { 6 3 3 \mathrm { \textbf { K } } }$ pure water test is the best qualitative indicator of in-reactor corrosion performance, and the 672 K steam test the poorest.

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_041_chunk2
证据片段: The assemblies contain a 17 by 17 array of fuel rods clad with conventional Zircaloy-4, ZIRLO, and the modified Zircaloy-4 materials previously described.

STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_041_chunk7
证据片段: The data in 727 K steam correctly identifies ZIRLO as the best material in-reactor

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_041_chunk7
证据片段: The pure-water 633 K autoclave test gave the best indication of in-reactor behavior.

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_041_chunk7
证据片段: After two cycles, the 633 K water test still gave the correct qualitative ranking of the materials

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_041_chunk7
证据片段: The data in the lithiated solutions, particularly at 70 ppm Li, indicate much better corrosion resistance of ZIRLO than the Zircaloys.

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_041_chunk7
证据片段: Corrosion rates of CON Zr-4, IMP Zr-4, and βQ Zr-4 in 70 ppm Li increased by a factor of about 5 to 6 over that in pure water compared to a rate increase for ZIRLO of about 1.5 times.

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_041_chunk7
证据片段: ZIRLO exhibited the best in-reactor corrosion performance with an average axial peak oxide thickness 32% of that formed on conventional Zircaloy-4.

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_041_chunk7
证据片段: ZiRLO cladding exhibited increased in-reactor dimensional stability with about 80% EY of the creep and 50% of the growth of Zircaloy-4.

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_041_chunk7
证据片段: Testing in steam at 672 K and 700 K failed to demonstrate the better performance of ZIRLO relative to Zircaloy-4.

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_041_chunk7
证据片段: Testing in steam at 672 K and 700 K failed to demonstrate the better performance of ZIRLO relative to Zircaloy-4.

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_041_chunk8
证据片段: The in-reactor superiority of ZIRLO over Zircaloy-4 ZIRLO is consistent with the greater resistance of ZIRLO to lithium-hydroxide solutions.

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_041_chunk8
证据片段: In the BR-3 data, the in-reactor corrosion resistance of ZIRLO was about $60 \%$ that of Zircaloy-4.
